de.a46.memory.gui
Class MPanel

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.awt.Component
        |
        +--java.awt.Container
              |
              +--java.awt.Panel
                    |
                    +--de.a46.memory.gui.MPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
MButton, MultiImagePanel
public class MPanel
extends java.awt.Panel

this class reacts like a button. There are 5 states defined. A MPanelListener can be registered to receive MPanel events similar to MouseEvents.

Note: it is not possible achieve the implemented behaviour by a common MouseListener. The order << mousePressed(), mouse dragged, mouseReleased() >> is not taken as a mouseClicked. So eventcasting is reimplemented here.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Till Zoppke
See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

ENABLED

public static final int ENABLED
encoding normal state: rollover and klicking possible, enter and exit events are casted.

DISABLED

public static final int DISABLED
disabled state. rollover and clicking disabled, but enter and exit events still casted.

ROLLOVER

public static final int ROLLOVER
rollover state, when the mouse entered an enabled mpanel.

PRESSED

public static final int PRESSED
pressed state, when the mouse is down.

DRAGGED

public static final int DRAGGED
dragged state, when the mouse moves by staying down.

status

protected int status
remembers the actual state of this component. Subclasses have protected access to this field to avoid causing a statusChanged() call.

id

protected int id
an int representing an ID for this MPanel.

setStatus

public void setStatus(int status)
sets the status of this . If the new status is different from the old one, statusChanged() is called.
Parameters:
status - an int as the new status of this MPanel.

getStatus

public int getStatus()
returns the actual state of this component.
Returns:
the current value for field status.

statusChanged

protected void statusChanged()
defines reaction to a changed status. This method can be overwritten by subclasses. Over here it is empty.

public void addMPanelListener(MPanelListener listener)
registers a MPanelListener to this MPanel.
Parameters:
listener - a MPanelListener that will receive events.
